Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Rev Stephanie Jaeger, Trinity Lutheran Church, located at 309 St Paul’s Avenue, Staten Island NY 10304.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Hanks.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Reverend Stephanie Jaeger, Trinity Lutheran Church, located at 309 St Paul’s Avenue, Staten Island N.Y. 10304.

Council Member Hanks moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: General Orders Calendar

Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.
Items.AgendaNote: INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS - Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of tax liens
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Sale of tax liens.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing expenditure limits for candidates in response to independent expenditures exceeding certain thresholds
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations, State & Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Increasing expenditure limits for candidates in response to independent expenditures exceeding certain thresholds.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a study and report on burial capacity on Hart Island
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Study and report on burial capacity on Hart Island.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Department of Health to confidentially share data regarding adverse maternal health events from the New York Patient Occurrence Reporting and Tracking System with the New York City Maternal Mortality Review Committee
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Hospitals
Items.MatterName: NYS Dept of Health to confidentially share data regarding adverse maternal health events from the NY Patient Occurrence Reporting and Tracking System with the NYC Maternal Mortality Review Committee.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended annually in seven business improvement districts and one special assessment district
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended annually in seven business improvement districts and one special assessment district.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended annually in seven business improvement districts and one special assessment district, and the setting of the date, time and place for the hearing of the local law increasing the annual expenditure for such districts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Increase in the amount to be expended annually in seven business improvement districts and one special assessment district, and the setting of the date, time and place for the hearing of the local law increasing the annual expenditure for such districts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring notice to condominium boards concerning the sale of tax liens
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Requiring notice to condominium boards concerning the sale of tax liens.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to redefining terms concerning immigration enforcement to account for current enforcement practices, and prohibiting the maintenance of an office or quarters on property under the jurisdiction of the department of correction by federal immigration authorities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Redefining terms concerning immigration enforcement to account for current enforcement practices, and prohibiting the maintenance of an office or quarters on property under the jurisdiction of the DOC by federal immigration authorities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Women’s National Basketball Association (WNBA) to commit to equitable revenue sharing, fair player compensation, and meaningful investment in women’s basketball, in support of the “Pay Us What You Owe Us” campaign led by WNBA players.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MatterName: Support of the “Pay Us What You Owe Us” campaign led by WNBA players.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on low-usage bike share stations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Reporting on low-usage bike share stations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to refunding or transferring unused pay-by-plate parking time, and to repeal subdivision e of section 19-167 of such code, relating to the prohibition on transfers of unused parking time between blockfaces
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Refunding or transferring unused pay-by-plate parking time, and to repeal subdivision e of section 19-167 of such code, relating to the prohibition on transfers of unused parking time between blockfaces.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a pilot program for location-specific vending licenses for Fordham Road in the borough of the Bronx
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection
Items.MatterName: Establishing a pilot program for location-specific vending licenses for Fordham Road in the borough of the Bronx.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing access to data around gender-based violence
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MatterName: Increasing access to data around gender-based violence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the department of social services issuing replacement transit benefit cards
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Department of social services issuing replacement transit benefit cards.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to department of buildings procedures regarding gaining access for inspections in response to a complaint
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Department of buildings procedures regarding gaining access for inspections in response to a complaint.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on New York City Health and Hospitals facilities to report adverse maternal health events to NYPORTS based on an expanded and standardized definition of adverse maternal health events, including adverse events at least 30 days post-partum
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Hospitals
Items.MatterName: NYC Health and Hospitals facilities to report adverse maternal health events to NYPORTS based on an expanded and standardized definition of adverse maternal health events, including adverse events at least 30 days post-partum.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Reporting regarding unresolved tax liens, and to repeal and replace section 11-356 of such code, relating to a temporary task force on tax liens.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Transfer of tax liens to a land bank.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Department of Health to create a new and separate occurrence code for maternal mortality and to standardize the definition of events reportable to the New York Patient Occurrence and Reporting Tracking System
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Hospitals

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Expanding access to roadway and sidewalk cafes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city construction codes, in relation to conforming provisions of such codes with provisions of the New York city existing building code and electrical and elevator inspections; and repealing sections 28-120.1.1, 28-120.1.2, 28-120.1.3, 28-120.2, 28-120.3, 28-316.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York; sections 102.6, 106.10, 901.9.1, 901.9.1.1, 901.9.2, 901.9.3, 901.9.4, 901.9.4.1, 901.9.4.2, 901.9.4.3, 901.9.5, 901.9.5.1, 901.9.5.3, 901.9.5.4, 901.9.6, 1101.3.1, 1101.3.2, 1101.3.3, 1101.3.4, 1101.3.5, 1101.3.5.1, 1101.3.5.2, 1101.4, 1601.2.1, 1601.2.2, 1601.2.3, 1601.2.4, 3001.11.1, 3303.10.3, D102, D103, D104, and D105  of the New York city building code; sections 102.2.1, 102.4.2.1, 102.4.2.2, 102.4.2.3, and 102.4.2.4 of the New York city fuel gas code; sections 102.4.2.1, 102.4.2.2, 102.4.2.3, 102.4.2.4, 102.4.2.5, 102.4.2.6, 1305.9.13 and 1305.16.1  of the New York city mechanical code; and sections 102.2.1, 102.2.2, 102.4.2.1, 102.4.2.2, 102.4.2.3, 601.3, 601.5 and 701.2.5 of the New York city plumbing code, relating to conforming provisions of such codes with provisions of the New York city existing building code
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: NYC construction codes, in relation to conforming provisions of such codes with provisions of the NYC existing building code and electrical and elevator inspections.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Hospitals
Items.MatterName: Calling on the New York State Department of Health to conduct regular reviews of NYPORTS data, and to require hospitals to retroactively fill in missing data.

ALISA FUENTES, Acting City Clerk

Items.MinutesNote: The Deputy Speaker (Council Member Ayala) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore at this meeting.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Deputy Speaker (Council Member Ayala).

There were 49 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.

There is one vacant seat in the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the November 4, 2025 General Election for the 2nd Council District in Manhattan.
The Deputy Speaker (Council Member Ayala) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 982-A,  VOTE: 41-8-0
Negative: Council Member Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Mealy, Morano, Palasdini, Vernikov, anf the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Int. No. 984-A,  VOTE: 42-7-0
Negative: Council Members Carr, Marmorato, Mealy, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Int. No. 1372,  VOTE: 42-7-0
Negative: Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Res. No. 1058-A,  VOTE: 41-8-0
Negative: Council Members Marmorato, Marte, Mealy, Morano, Paladino, Stevens, Zhuang, and the Minority Leader(Council Member Ariola).











See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
